paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the L532P mutation in the KCNH2 gene, detailing its functional effects and implications for cardiac action potential repolarization.

functional_data.summary: The L532P mutation results in a significant shift in activation and inactivation properties of the hERG channel, leading to altered cardiac repolarization.

variants.additional_notes: The study provides insights into the functional consequences of the L532P mutation but does not report specific patient data.
key_quotes: The L532P mutation produced an ~ 5-fold increase in the IC50 for dronedarone inhibition of IhERG.
L532P hERG showed greater activation than WT IhERG but an ~+ 36 mV shift in activation V0.5 compared to the WT channel.

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily focuses on the functional characterization of the L532P variant without providing specific patient data.
